name: Cauliflower Rice
description: Recipe video above. Don't make this expecting it to taste exactly like rice. It doesn't - the texture is different, the flavour is different. BUT it's a tasty, much lower calorie alternative to rice with a neutral flavour that makes it a great healthy option for serving with saucy foods. Once doused with tasty stir fry sauces or curries, you may well forget you're eating cauliflower. And think of what you can do with all the calorie credits!!! {77% less calories, 87% less carbs than rice}
recipeIngredient: 1  head cauliflower ((or 500g/1lb store bought prepared cauliflower rice, Note 1))

recipeInstructions.text: Cut / break cauliflower into florets (including stems) that will fit into the feeding tube of food processor.
recipeInstructions.name: Cut / break cauliflower into florets (including stems) that will fit into the feeding tube of food processor.

recipeInstructions.text: Fit food processor with grating disc. Place lid on, then push the florets into the feeding tube with the motor running on low.
recipeInstructions.name: Fit food processor with grating disc. Place lid on, then push the florets into the feeding tube with the motor running on low.

recipeInstructions.text: Cauliflower will blitz into rice shaped bits! Can use raw but I prefer cooking it - use a method below.
recipeInstructions.name: Cauliflower will blitz into rice shaped bits! Can use raw but I prefer cooking it - use a method below.

itemListElement.text: Food processor standard "S" blade - fill halfway with florets, pulse 4 to 5 times until largest bits are the size of cooked rice (half will be couscous size, half rice sized). Repeat as needed.
itemListElement.name: Food processor standard "S" blade - fill halfway with florets, pulse 4 to 5 times until largest bits are the size of cooked rice (half will be couscous size, half rice sized). Repeat as needed.

itemListElement.text: Hand grating - cut whole cauliflower into quarters, then grate by hand.
itemListElement.name: Hand grating - cut whole cauliflower into quarters, then grate by hand.

itemListElement.text: Only cook cauliflower rice until it is just cooked - don't let it go soft and mushy (it gets watery).
itemListElement.name: Only cook cauliflower rice until it is just cooked - don't let it go soft and mushy (it gets watery).

itemListElement.text: Roasting - drizzle with 1 tbsp olive oil. Toss, spread on tray, bake at 200¬∞C/390¬∞F for 15 minutes, tossing halfway through cook time.
itemListElement.name: Roasting - drizzle with 1 tbsp olive oil. Toss, spread on tray, bake at 200¬∞C/390¬∞F for 15 minutes, tossing halfway through cook time.

itemListElement.text: Microwave - place in container with lid with vent open. Microwave 4 to 5 minutes on high until tender crisp. Don't overcook too soggy.
itemListElement.name: Microwave - place in container with lid with vent open. Microwave 4 to 5 minutes on high until tender crisp. Don't overcook too soggy.

itemListElement.text: Oven steam - place in covered baking dish, bake 200¬∞C/390¬∞F for 20 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Oven steam - place in covered baking dish, bake 200¬∞C/390¬∞F for 20 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Stove - Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in large skillet over medium high heat. Optional: Cook 2 minced garlic cloves 20 sec until golden. Add rice, cook 4 to 5 minutes, stirring every minute or so, for 5 minutes until just cooked.
itemListElement.name: Stove - Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in large skillet over medium high heat. Optional: Cook 2 minced garlic cloves 20 sec until golden. Add rice, cook 4 to 5 minutes, stirring every minute or so, for 5 minutes until just cooked.

itemListElement.text: Serve in place of rice with stir fries, curries, anything saucy that you like serving with rice.
itemListElement.name: Serve in place of rice with stir fries, curries, anything saucy that you like serving with rice.

itemListElement.text: Use in place of rice or grains in salads and fried rice.
itemListElement.name: Use in place of rice or grains in salads and fried rice.

review.reviewBody:
Your comment in the post ‚Äú Even if you‚Äôre a cynic (and I was for a very long time), I really hope you give this a go at least once. Think of all the calories you‚Äôre saving ‚Äì and what you can use all those calorie credits for! üòÇ ‚Äì Nagi x‚Äù 



Cracked me up !!!!! Hahaha 

Thanks for the recipe, as always !

Excellent! We ate it with salmon in lime coconut sauce. Not sure it will stop me reaching for the jar of rice every time but the carb saving alone certainly makes it very attractive. Many thanks for all your fabulous recipes üòã

I've been making cauliflower rice for a few years now, but I never thought of roasting it, always opting to nuke or saut√© it What a revelation! There were some browned crispy bits on top (yum!) and as you said, roasting imparted some nuttiness to the dish. Thanks Nagi!
Oh boy! I am a total convert to the mighty cauliflower rice. So easy and so delicious. Next I will be making all the rice recipes I can find with cauliflower as a sub. Yummy yummy

keywords: cauliflower rice, healthy rice, low carb side dish
